text: Re-enter Sir John is a 1932 British crime novel written by Clemence Dane and Helen Simpson. It was the sequel to the 1928 novel Enter Sir John, which had been adapted into a film Murder! by Alfred Hitchcock. The story continued the adventures of the actor-manager Sir John Saumarez.White p.82 ==References== ==Bibliography== * White, Terry. Justice Denoted: The Legal Thriller in American, British, and Continental Courtroom Literature. Praeger, 2003. title: Re-enter Sir John
